none: Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.). School of Music (Contributor)
Footage from 1947 and 1957 is silent. (General Note)
Northwestern University Video Cassette Collection--Northwestern University Marching Band Highlights
Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.). School of Music
Bock, Jerry. Fiddler on the roof
Bock, Jerry. Fiddler on the roof. Matchmaker
Bock, Jerry. Fiddler on the roof. Sunrise, sunset

Highlights from the Northwestern University Marching Band's 1982, 1972, 1957, and 1947 seasons. Highlights begin with the pregame performance from the September 25, 1982 Northwestern Wildcats' game against the Northern Illinois Huskies at Dyche Stadium in Evanston, Illinois. The pregame performances include "America the Beautiful," the National Anthem, "NIU Fight Song," "Got To Get You Into My Life," and "Go U Northwestern." Halftime performances include the theme music from "Dallas" and "Days of Our Lives," music from "Fame," and "Alma Mater." Fans took to the field after the game to celebrate the Northwestern Wildcats' first victory in 34 games. The next highlight is ABC Sports coverage of the Northwestern University Marching Band's performance at the October 28, 1972 Northwestern Wildcats' Homecoming game against the Indiana Hoosiers at Dyche Stadium in Evanston, Illinois. For the halftime performance, Northwestern alumni and lyricist Sheldon Harnick joins conductor John P. Paynter for a selection of songs from "Fiddler on the Roof" including "Matchmaker, Matchmaker" and "Sunrise Sunset." The NUMB alums join the band for a performance of "To Life." The highlights conclude with footage of Northwestern University Marching Band's performances during the 1957 and 1947 seasons. The band is conducted by John P. Paynter.

The recordings on this web site are provided for use by Northwestern University students, faculty, staff and guests. Further distribution and/or any commercial use of these recordings from this site is strictly prohibited. Please contact specialcollections@northwestern.edu for more information
Northwestern University Libraries Digital Collections API
Homepage at Northwestern University Libraries Digital Collections

Digitization of this collection was funded by a generous gift from the family of Music professor and bandleader John Phillip Paynter, who began his musical studies at Northwestern, graduating with a Bachelor of Music degree in 1950 and a Master's in Theory and Composition in 1951. Upon graduation, Paynter joined NU's faculty as the Director of the Marching Band. During his career at Northwestern, Paynter taught classes in band music, conducting, and arranging.
